title: City Hall Holiday Hours 2025
content:
City Hall will be closed on the following dates for 2025:

- New Year's Day (January 1)
- Martin Luther King Jr. Day (January 20)
- Presidents Day (February 17)
- Memorial Day (May 26)
- Independence Day (July 4)
- Labor Day (September 1)
- Veterans Day (November 11)
- Thanksgiving (November 27-28)
- Christmas (December 25)

For emergencies during closures, call (305) 593-6600.

title: Emergency Contact Numbers
content:
Important City of Doral contact numbers:

- Police Non-Emergency: (305) 593-6699
- Fire Department: (305) 593-6710
- Code Compliance: (305) 593-6740
- Public Works: (305) 593-6740
- Water/Sewer Emergency (after hours): (305) 593-6740
- Parks & Recreation: (305) 593-6600
- Building Department: (305) 593-6730

For all emergencies, dial 911.

title: Business Tax Receipt Renewal Deadline
content:
All City of Doral business tax receipts must be renewed by September 30th each year.

Late renewal penalties:
- After September 30th: 10% penalty
- Additional 1.5% interest per month

Renewal options:
- Online at cityofdoral.com/btax
- In person at City Hall (8401 NW 53rd Terrace)
- By mail

Required documents: Current state license (if applicable), proof of insurance, and previous year's tax receipt.

title: Recycling Pickup Schedule
content:
Curbside recycling collection schedule:

- Single-family homes: Every Wednesday
- Multi-family units: Check with property management

Place recyclables at the curb by 7:00 AM.

Accepted items:
- Paper and cardboard
- Plastic bottles (#1-#7)
- Glass bottles and jars
- Aluminum and steel cans

NOT accepted:
- Plastic bags
- Styrofoam
- Food-soiled items
- Electronics
- Hazardous waste

title: Doral Trolley Service Hours
content:
The Doral Trolley is a FREE public transportation service.

Operating Hours:
- Monday-Friday: 6:30 AM to 8:00 PM
- Saturday: 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM
- Sunday: No service
- City holidays: No service

Routes: Blue Line, Gold Line, and Red Line serve major destinations including Downtown Doral, Doral Central Park, City Hall, and FIU.

Real-time tracking: Download the Doral Trolley app for live arrival times.

title: Building Permit Requirements
content:
Common permits required for construction projects:

1. Building Permit - Required for new construction, additions, and major renovations
2. Electrical Permit - For electrical work
3. Plumbing Permit - For plumbing installations
4. Mechanical Permit - For HVAC systems
5. Roofing Permit - For roof replacement or repair

Application process:
- Submit plans to Building Department
- Pay applicable fees
- Schedule inspections

Contact: (305) 593-6730 or visit cityofdoral.com/building

title: Hurricane Preparedness Essentials
content:
Hurricane season: June 1 - November 30

Emergency kit essentials:
- Water (1 gallon per person per day for 7 days)
- Non-perishable food (7-day supply)
- Medications
- First aid kit
- Flashlights and batteries
- Important documents in waterproof container
- Cash
- Phone chargers

Sign up for Doral Alert: cityofdoral.com/doralalert

Evacuation zones: Check your zone at cityofdoral.com/emergency

title: Parking Regulations Downtown Doral
content:
Downtown Doral parking rules:

- Street parking: 2-hour limit (Mon-Sat 8am-6pm)
- Parking meters: $1.50/hour
- Public garages: First 2 hours free, then $2/hour

No parking zones:
- Fire lanes (red curbs)
- Loading zones (yellow curbs)
- Handicap spaces without valid placard

Violations:
- Expired meter: $35
- Fire lane: $100
- Handicap violation: $250

Pay by phone: Use the ParkMobile app

title: Youth Sports Registration
content:
City of Doral Parks & Recreation youth sports programs:

- Basketball (ages 6-14)
- Soccer (ages 4-16)
- Baseball/Softball (ages 5-14)
- Flag Football (ages 5-14)
- Volleyball (ages 8-14)

Registration:
- Residents: $75/season
- Non-residents: $95/season

Register online at cityofdoral.com/sports or at the Parks office at Legacy Park.

Required: Birth certificate, proof of residency, medical clearance form.

title: Code Compliance Common Violations
content:
Most common code violations in Doral:

1. Overgrown grass/weeds (over 10 inches)
2. Unpermitted construction
3. Commercial vehicles parked in residential areas
4. Illegal signage
5. Trash cans visible from street
6. Inoperable vehicles on property
7. Illegal short-term rentals

Report violations:
- Doral 311 app
- Call (305) 593-6740
- Online at cityofdoral.com/311

First violation: Warning letter
Repeat violations: Fines up to $250/day
